intro: Filago libyaca, commonly known as the Libyan filago, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Filago libyaca is often found in open habitats such as steppes and scrublands.
